name: Detlef Plump
content: q Home page of Detlef Plump Detlef Plump I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of York, where I am a member of the Automated Software Engineering research group. Current Research Students Robert SÃ¶ldner: A Verification Assistant for Graph Programs PhD student since 2020 (part-time) Former Research Students Ziad Ismaili Alaoui: Speeding up Graph Programs MSc by Research thesis, 2025 Federico Vastarini: Random Graph Generation in Hyperedge Replacement Languages PhD thesis, 2024 Brian Courtehoute: Time and Space Complexity of Rule-Based Graph Programs PhD thesis, 2023 Gia Wulandari: Verifying Graph Programs with Monadic Second-Order Logic PhD thesis, 2021 Tim Atkinson: Evolving Graphs by Graph Programming PhD thesis, 2019 (co-supervised with Susan Stepney) Ivaylo Hristakiev: Confluence Analysis for a Graph Programming Language PhD thesis, 2017 Chris Bak: GP 2: Efficient Implementation of a Graph Programming Language PhD thesis, 2015 Chris Poskitt: Verification of Graph Programs PhD thesis, 2013 Mike Dodds: Graph Transformation and Pointer Structures PhD thesis, 2008 Sandra Steinert: The Graph Programming Language GP PhD thesis, 2007 Events TERMGRAPH 2026 - 14th International Workshop on Computing with Terms and Graphs (Part of FLoC 2026).
